DataElement.preferredDefinition: The means or manner of procedure in directing a biopsy needle into an area of interest within the breast.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Imaging examination of the breast by means of x-rays.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiography used specifically to examine breast tissue. The procedure utilizes a low-dose of x-rays or radiation to generate an image. A mammography exam or mammogram, is used as a screening tool to detect early breast cancer in women experiencing no symptoms and to detect and diagnose breast disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer.

Concepts.definition: The use of high-frequency sound waves to generate images of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Examination by pressing on the surface of the body to feel the organs or tissues underneath.

Concepts.definition: A method of feeling with the hands during a physical examination. The health care provider touches and feels the patient's body to examine the size, consistency, texture, location and tenderness of an organ or body part.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.
